description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Dalyan" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Dalyan

places.generalDescription: İztuzu Beach, also known as Turtle Beach, has a rich history of conservation efforts thanks to the dedication of June Haimoff, who fought against resort development and established the Kaptan June Sea Turtle Conservation Project. The beach is a haven for loggerhead sea turtles and offers visitors the chance to see these magnificent creatures in their natural habitat.

sources.snippet: consisting of a long sandy beach that stretches where it meets the mediterranean, dalyan, iztuzu beach, caretta caretta sea turtles in the world the protection of the eggs of the few places in the area. 20:00 and 08:00 hours between the beach and enter a light around burn, vehicle use, fire and sand is forbidden to dig. according to time magazine, survey results from british, has been ranked among the world's best beaches, the protected iztuzu beach.

Dalyan is actually a popular destination among expats, with a significant population of U.K. and Dutch nationals living there year-round. It takes a certain type of person to love this place as there are no shopping malls or beach clubs close by, yet there is tranquility and ease to the spectacular mountainous backdrop and the beautiful Dalyan River with its unique-shaped boats passing by.
sources.shortName: Dalyan diaries: Discovering Turkey’s secret little gem

sources.snippet: This town, situated alongside the Dalyan River (originally the Calbys River), features attractions like ancient Lycian Rock tombs and the picturesque Iztuzu Beach (home to the local Caretta Caretta turtles). As this town is a preserved area, there are restrictions on the construction of homes, allowing the town to keep a traditional Turkey feel.
sources.shortName: Ultimate Guide to Dalyan, Turkey: Best Things to Do

sources.snippet: It was only in the year 1987 that the town gained international popularity when some developers decided to build a luxury hotel near Iztuzu Beach. And now that it has spread its reach for all the right reasons, read on to know how you can make the most of your visit to Dalyan.
sources.shortName: Dalyan-Caunos-Turtle beach | An Excursion Must Be Experienced

sources.snippet: The beach spawning area of the rare Caretta Caretta turtles in the world. The beach is surrounded by wires in certain areas. In these areas, cute carettas are burying their eggs in July-August nights.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do and See In Dalyan – Enjoy Dalyan

sources.snippet: However, the discovery of the rare Caretta Caretta (loggerhead turtles) nesting on Iztuzu Beach in the mid-1980s led to the area’s protection, preserving its natural beauty.
sources.siteName: Tourism Turkey: Top Travel Spots and Tourist Attractions
sources.shortName: Dalyan Coast - Turkey: Scenic Coastal Getaways 2025

sources.snippet: Dalyan Iztuzu (Turtle) Beach is 10km away from Dalyan town centre. The Iztuzu Beach is home for Caretta Carettta's where they lay their eggs.
sources.shortName: Sedir Resort - Dalyan Trips Kaunos Iztuzu Caretta Mud Baths Hot Spring
Dalyan Guide - Turtle beach, Mud Baths, Kaunos, Top Things to Do & See

places.name: İztuzu Beach

reviews.text:
The beach is great. But with few hours hike is the best.
We parked cars on last bigger parking place bit over beach and walked around by marked path up/down to beach.
Awesome place to visit. You can also see a real turtle hospital. Not a for-profit turtle farm but a place where they really save these animals.

Lovely beach , water was nice and warm in August . Calm enough to swim. Soft golden sand . Good facilities including changing rooms and showers. Tour boats can bring you here and also stop off to show you the turtles in the sea just before you arrive.
Really nice, clean beach, the dolmus end is cheaper than the boat end. And the turtle hospital is in walking distance.

Very nice, spacious and clean sandy beach. Water is crystal clear and it's shallow for like 20 meters. The only downside was the parasols; they're rather small and don't have great coverage. However the beach is pretty cheap -100 TL for a couple of beds and a parasol -  so it's definitely worth it.
Great beach with cafe , toilets, changing etc. entrance is 200TL for the car and 350TL for 2 sunbeds .

places.generalDescription: Turtle Beach Hotel is a laid-back accommodation option in Dalyan, Turkey, situated between the popular districts of Fethiye and Marmaris. The area is renowned for its stunning natural beauty and offers easy access to Iztuzu Beach, a picturesque white sand beach known as the nesting place of endangered loggerhead turtles. The hotel provides simply furnished apartments, an outdoor pool, a bar, and a restaurant.

sources.snippet: It is one of the main breeding grounds for loggerhead sea turtles (Caretta caretta) in the Mediterranean and is therefore often referred to as Turtle Beach. The loggerhead turtle (Caretta caretta) is on the IUCN Red list of endangered animals. For this reason the beach has had a protected status since 1988 and is part of the Köyceğiz-Dalyan Special Environmental Protection Area.

Then it's time to swim at DALYAN TURTLE BEACH, which is listed as one of the best in the world. Keep the cameras close at hand because you may have the chance to imagine CARETTA, the loggerhead, which has been a huge sea turtle breeder in this region for 95 million years. Our Dalyan tours can be organized individually.

The crystal-clear waters of Dalyan Turtle Beach provides a once in a lifetime swimming experience. The water is not only clear but also home to a hugely diverse range of aquatic life. We all love diving down and seeing schools of fish here and there, but Turtle Beach is like nothing you’ve ever seen before.
sources.shortName: Dalyan Turtle Beach, Turkey - All You Need To Know (2024)

places.name: Turtle Beach Hotel

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) When you consider the number of people and the price, it was very affordable. We stayed in September 2024 for 2500 TL per night. The rooms were good. The furnishings were a bit old, unfortunately, the cleaning could be better because the pillowcases, sheets and covers were not changed, they did not smell clean, they smelled bad. There is only one air conditioner in one room and it is a bit noisy. Ms. Emine helps with everything.
If you do not have a car, places like Migros and the bazaar are 5 minutes away on foot, but a car is required for the beaches because there is no beach nearby.

(Original)
Kişi sayısını ve ücreti düşündüğünüz de gayet uygundu Eylül 2024 de geceliği 2500 TL den kaldık, odalar iyiydi eşyalar biraz eski maalesef temizlik daha iyi olabilir çünkü yastık kılıfları çarşaflar ve örtüler değiştirilmemiş temiz kokmuyor du, kötü kokuyordu. Sadece bir oda da klima var biraz sesli çalışıyor. Emine hanım her konuda yardımcı oluyor.
Aracınız yoksa Migros ve çarşı gibi yerler yürüyerek 5 dakika ama plajlar için araba şart yakında plaj yok çünkü
